decks.notes: This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Torch the Tower and Molten Collapse while steadily increasing its own aggression with creatures like Stadium Headliner and Rottenmouth Viper. The deck also includes graveyard recursion with cards like Corpses of the Lost and Case of the Stashed Skeleton to maintain a steady stream of threats. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around overwhelming opponents with a combination of fast creatures and direct damage spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of spells and abilities that allow you to disrupt your opponent's strategy while building up your own resources. By using cards like Firebending Lesson, Abandon Attachments, and Combustion Technique, you can effectively manage the battlefield and gain an advantage. Additionally, utilizing cards like Stock Up and Accumulate Wisdom helps you draw more cards and find the answers you need to maintain control. With a mix of removal spells and powerful creatures like Gran-Gran and Ral, Crackling Wit, you can dominate the game and emerge victorious.

The deck revolves around assembling a powerful combination of creatures and spells that synergize with each other to create a strong board presence and control the battlefield. By utilizing efficient creatures like Aang and Appa, along with powerful spells like Airbender Ascension and Meticulous Archive, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its versatile and strategic gameplay. With careful planning and strategic decision-making, the deck can quickly gain control of the game and lead to victory through careful manipulation of its resources and combat options.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, using a combination of evasive threats like Quantum Riddler and direct damage like Torch the Tower. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with cards like Fear of Missing Out and Frostcliff Siege. By staying proactive and constantly pushing damage, this UR Aggro deck seeks to quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By combining the aggressive creatures like Cecil, Dark Knight and Spyglass Siren with spells like Stab and Shoot the Sheriff, this deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Enduring Curiosity and Tishana's Tidebinder provide card advantage and control elements to maintain tempo. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana fixing and access to different resources.

This Esper aggro deck focuses on a combination of aggressive creatures like Nurturing Pixie and Sunpearl Kirin, along with disruptive spells like No More Lies and Tragic Trajectory to control the opponent's board. The deck also includes powerful card draw spells like Enduring Curiosity and Stormchaser's Talent to maintain card advantage. Kaito, Bane of Nightmares provides additional threats and Restless Anchorage offers some utility. The mana base includes a mix of lands to ensure consistent color access for the deck's demanding casting costs. Ultimately, the deck aims to pressure opponents while disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells and counterspells, while also utilizing card draw and lifegain to outvalue the opponent. By carefully managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to stabilize and ultimately win through powerful finishers like Shiko, Paragon of the Way and Marang River Regent. The mana base is designed to support the three-color Jeskai strategy, ensuring a consistent and smooth mana curve. With careful play and strategic decision-making, this deck aims to outlast and outsmart the opponent in a battle of attrition.

The main concept of this Temur Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Llanowar Elves and Willowrush Verge, and then overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures like Doc Aurlock, Grizzled Genius and Railway Brawler, along with powerful spells like Devastating Onslaught and Into the Flood Maw. The deck also includes cards like Esper Origins and Winternight Stories to provide card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent. The overall strategy is to be aggressive and maintain a strong board presence to outpace and defeat the opponent.

The main focus of this Dimir Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Spyglass Siren and Floodpits Drowner, the deck aims to control the board while dealing damage quickly with creatures like Deep-Cavern Bat and Cecil, Dark Knight. Enduring Curiosity helps to maintain card advantage, while cards like Stab and Shoot the Sheriff provide removal options. Tishana's Tidebinder and Preacher of the Schism add versatility to the deck, making it capable of adapting to different matchups.

The deck focuses on a aggressive gameplay style that utilizes a combination of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Spyglass Siren and Floodpits Drowner to control the board, while also dealing damage with cards like Shoot the Sheriff and Tragic Trajectory. The deck also includes cards like Enduring Curiosity to draw additional cards and maintain card advantage. With a mix of control and aggression, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and finish the game quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with aggressive creatures like Thundertrap Trainer and Quantum Riddler while using cheap removal spells like Burst Lightning and Abrade to clear the way for them. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent by constantly attacking with creatures and utilizing cards like Boomerang Basics and Stock Up for additional card advantage. The inclusion of Ral, Crackling Wit provides additional reach and card advantage, while the mana base allows for consistent casting of spells and creatures.

The main focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to effectively control the game through a combination of removal spells, card draw, and powerful finishers. The deck aims to control the board with spells like Lightning Helix and dispelling Exhale while maintaining card advantage with Meticulous Archive and Consult the Star Charts. Marang River Regent and Ultima serve as impactful finishers, while Shiko, Paragon of the Way provides additional control and protection. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and ensure smooth gameplay.

The main concept of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the board through removal spells and counter magic while generating card advantage through card draw effects. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy using various interactive spells. The inclusion of cards like Lightning Helix and Day of Judgment helps to control the board, while cards like Consult the Star Charts and Meticulous Archive provide card advantage. The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game until it can secure a win condition, such as Marang River Regent or Aang's Iceberg.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures and removal spells. The deck includes a variety of high-impact creatures like Voice of Victory and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant, supported by removal spells like Seam Rip and Adagia, Windswept Bastion. The deck aims to quickly establish board presence and take control of the game through aggressive attacks and efficient removal, using the synergy between creatures and spells to keep the pressure on the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Llanowar Elves and Gene Pollinator to play big creatures like Jackal, Genius Geneticist and Ouroboroid. Utilizing the synergy between creatures like Pawpatch Recruit and Floodpits Drowner to control the board. Innkeeper's Talent helps to refill the hand and keep up the pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast mana generation, aggressive creatures, and card advantage. The inclusion of Tyvar, the Pummeler adds another threat to the board and Nature's Rhythm helps to fix mana and enable more explosive plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing the reanimation abilities of cards like Awaken the Honored Dead and Overlord of the Balemurk to bring powerful creatures such as Terror of the Peaks and Ardyn, the Usurper back into play from the graveyard. It also includes support cards like Bitter Triumph and Bringer of the Last Gift to help facilitate the reanimation strategy. The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures, then bring them back onto the battlefield for powerful combo plays and overwhelming board presence.
